meanings.definition: Less strict or severe in discipline or control.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was laxer with homework deadlines this semester.
meanings.sent2: She preferred a laxer approach to parenting, allowing her children more freedom.
meanings.sent3: The laxer rules at the amusement park made it easier for kids to enjoy themselves.
meanings.sent4: His laxer grip on the steering wheel made her nervous during the drive.
meanings.sent5: The laxer security measures at the event led to some unexpected guests.

meanings.definition: More relaxed or loose in attitude or behavior.
meanings.sent1: After the stressful week, she felt much laxer about her work responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: He had a laxer approach to time management, often arriving late to meetings.
meanings.sent3: The laxer dress code at the office allowed employees to wear jeans on Fridays.
meanings.sent4: Her laxer grip on reality sometimes led her to believe in silly superstitions.
meanings.sent5: The laxer schedule on weekends meant they could sleep in and relax more.
